subject: Art & Design
title: Egyptian Art: Eternity in Stone
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Egyptian Art: Eternity in Stone.

hook.text: Egyptian artists painted people with frontal eyes on profile faces. It wasn't a mistake.

buildup.text: Egyptian art followed strict rules for 3,000 years. Shoulders faced front, feet faced sideways.

discovery.text: The goal wasn't realism â€” it was completeness. Show every body part in its clearest angle.

twist.text: Pharaohs were painted larger than servants. Size equaled importance, not actual height.

climax.text: Art was functional: tomb paintings were meant to accompany the dead into the afterlife.

punchline.text: They didn't paint what they saw. They painted what mattered.

quiz.question: Why did Egyptian art show bodies in mixed perspectives?
options: To show each body part at its clearest angle
